pages.text: Pugs only have one gene that has been witnessed to affect how they look, and this is the B Locus. This gene will determine whether they have primarily fawn fur with a black mask, or purely black fur.

The B Locus has two potential alleles, the dominant 'B' and the recessive 'b'. The 'B' allele creates lighter, fawn fur with a black mask, while the 'b' allele creates pure black fur. Dogs with one copy of 'b' will carry the black trait and may pass it on to pups, providing the potential for black pups depending on the other parent. Dogs with two copies of 'b' will always create either black carriers or black puppies.
